alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Lewis (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 28 at 3:31AM EST until January 28 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST THIS MORNING... ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 1 PM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, lake effect snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to 2 inches early this morning south of Watertown toward the Tug Hill in the most persistent lake snows. * WHERE...Jefferson and Lewis counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, from 10 PM this evening to 1 PM EST Saturday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 10 AM EST this morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: This is a potentially dangerous situation to be outdoors. If you must be outside, be sure to cover all exposed skin. Frostbite can occur in 15 minutes or less with apparent temperatures of 25 below zero or colder. Lake effect snow will fall in relatively narrow bands. If traveling, be prepared for rapidly changing road conditions and visibilities. Submit snow reports through our website or social media.
